IngredientsList.name: Blue Mountain Flower
IngredientsList.description: A low lying shrub with multiple blue flowers. Common throughout lowland Skyrim, particularly Whiterun Hold, Falkreath Hold, the Rift and Hjaalmarch.

IngredientsList.name: Briarheart
IngredientsList.description: A magically altered bundle of plant material created by the forsworn of the Reach. Found in the chest cavity of forsworn warriors, known as Briarhearts, in place of their heart.

IngredientsList.name: Canis Root
IngredientsList.description: The root of a small, gnarled bush. Commonplace in the Rift and Hjaalmarch.

IngredientsList.name: Creep Cluster
IngredientsList.description: A low-lying mass of red roots, commonly found growing on rocks in Eastmarch's volcanic tundra.

IngredientsList.name: Crimson Nirnroot
IngredientsList.description: An exceptionally rare variant of the Nirnroot plant, rumored to grow in Blackreach.

IngredientsList.name: Deathbell
IngredientsList.description: A large blue hanging flower, most common in the swampy areas of Hjaalmarch.

IngredientsList.name: Dragon's Tongue
IngredientsList.description: A reedy plant with large, rounded, gold flowers, found in the volcanic tundra in Eastmarch.

IngredientsList.name: Elves Ear
IngredientsList.description: Dried it becomes a common household ingredient found in kitchens and camps across Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: Frost Mirriam
IngredientsList.description: A green herb with delicate frilled leaves. A common cooking ingredient found in homes across Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: Garlic
IngredientsList.description: A pungent bulb that grows underground but forms the basis of many recipes. Commonly found throughout Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: Giant Lichen
IngredientsList.description: Grows as a collection of broad red/black circles on rocky surfaces, stems appear as it matures. Found thoughout the mashes of Hjaalmarch.

IngredientsList.name: Gleamblossom
IngredientsList.description: An exceptionally rare luminescent plant, found only in the Forgotten Vale and Darkfall Passage.

IngredientsList.name: Grass Pod
IngredientsList.description: The spear-like seed pod of a rough, spiky grass that grows around Morthal and along Skyrim's Northern coast.

IngredientsList.name: Hanging Moss
IngredientsList.description: A prominent, deep-green beard-like moss found in humid regions, particularly the steep valleys of the Reach.

IngredientsList.name: Jazaby Grapes
IngredientsList.description: The fruit of the low-lying, yellow-leaved jazaby plant that grows on rocky outcroppings in the volcanic region of Eastmarch.

IngredientsList.name: Juniper Berries
IngredientsList.description: Grey-green, shiny berries that grow on medium large trees throughout the Reach.

IngredientsList.name: Lavender
IngredientsList.description: An aromatic, spear-like flower. Rich purple in color it is common in Skyrim, particularly in Whiterun hold.

IngredientsList.name: Nightshade
IngredientsList.description: A grey/purple star shaped flower. Found throughout skyrim, particularly in graveyards.

IngredientsList.name: Nirnroot
IngredientsList.description: A broad-leaved shrub that produces a unique ringing hum. Commonly found near sources of water.

IngredientsList.name: Poison Bloom
IngredientsList.description: A rare plant found only in Darkfall Passage. Release a poisonous gas on contact making harvesting a dangerous prospect.

IngredientsList.name: Purple Mountain Flower
IngredientsList.description: A low-lying shrub with many light-purple flowers. Common throughout skyrim at low elevations, particularly Falkreath Hold, the Rift, Eastmarch and Whiterun Hold.

IngredientsList.name: Red Mountain Flower
IngredientsList.description: A low-lying shrub with many red flowers. Common throughout skyrim at low elevations, particularly Falkreath Hold, the Rift, Eastmarch and Whiterun Hold.

IngredientsList.name: Snowberries
IngredientsList.description: Bright red berries that grow on a low shrub with spiky green leaves. Common throughout snowy areas of Skyrim including the Pale and Winterhold.

IngredientsList.name: Swamp Fungal Pod
IngredientsList.description: Large whitish grey pods that grow at gound level in the mashes of Hjaalmarch.

IngredientsList.name: Thistle Branch
IngredientsList.description: A strong stemmed plant topped with distinctive purple flowers. Common at low elevations, particularly in the pine forests of Falkreath Hold.

IngredientsList.name: Tundra Cotton
IngredientsList.description: A low lying plant with charactertic white fluffy flowers. Common throughout Whiterun Hold.

IngredientsList.name: Wheat
IngredientsList.description: A domesticated species of grass grown as food. Commonly found in farmland across Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: Yellow Mountain Flower
IngredientsList.description: A rare yellowed flowered variety of the otherwise common mountain flower. Found mostly in the Ancestor Glade in Falkreath Hold.

IngredientsList.name: Bleeding Crown
IngredientsList.description: Large mushrooms with pointed caps. The tip is a deep crimson while the rim is a pale white. Grows in caves throughout Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: Blisterwort
IngredientsList.description: Tall white stems, with broad orange-red caps covered in white specks. Found in caves throughout Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: Fly Amanita
IngredientsList.description: Tall white stems with broad bright red caps. Similar to Blisterwort but without spots. commonly found in caves.

IngredientsList.name: Glowing Mushroom
IngredientsList.description: A luminous green shelf-cap mushroom with hanging tendrils resembling a jellyfish. A rare species typically found in caves. Lost Echo Cave and Torvald's Gap are notable sources.

IngredientsList.name: Imp Stool
IngredientsList.description: Stout cream steams with domed yellow caps. Found in caves throughout Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: Mora Tapinella
IngredientsList.description: A brown shelf cap with white gills that grows on dead wood throughout forested regions of Skyrim. Notably absent in the Rift where scale Pholiota is more common.

IngredientsList.name: Namira's Rot
IngredientsList.description: A tall mushroom with white stems and a nearly flat brown cap. Found in caves throughout Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: Scaly Pholiota
IngredientsList.description: A bright white shef cap that grows on falled trees and dead stumps in the birch forests found in the Reach.

IngredientsList.name: White Cap
IngredientsList.description: A tall, pale-white species with a flat cap. Found in caves throughout Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: Abecean Longfin
IngredientsList.description: A small, grey-black freshwater fish found in ponds and lakes. Commonly found in areas with dragonflies.

IngredientsList.name: Ancestor Moth Wing
IngredientsList.description: Wings of the ancestor moth, a rare species found only in the Ancestor Glade.

IngredientsList.name: Bear Claws
IngredientsList.description: Deep black and rock hard, they can be harvested from all varieties of bear which are found across Skyrim's wilderness.

IngredientsList.name: Bee
IngredientsList.description: A small, colony-living insect. Found in large numbers close to their hives which they build in Skyrim's low-lying wooded areas.

IngredientsList.name: Beehive Husk
IngredientsList.description: The papery material created by bees that forms the structural part of their hives. The are built in trees in Skyrim's low elevation forests.

IngredientsList.name: Blue Butterfly Wing
IngredientsList.description: Blue winged butterflies frequent flowers at Skyrim's lower elevations. Most active during the day, they rest at night.

IngredientsList.name: Blue Dartwing
IngredientsList.description: Commonly seen during daylight hours, flitting back and forth over Skyrim's many lakes and ponds.

IngredientsList.name: Bonemeal
IngredientsList.description: The ground remains of undead creatures such as skeletons and draugr. Widely available to any able to survive an encounter with the undead.

IngredientsList.name: Butterfly Wing
IngredientsList.description: The bright orange wing of the Monarch butterfly. Found during daylight hours hovering over flowers in Skyrim's warmer regions.

IngredientsList.name: Charred Skeever Hide
IngredientsList.description: Skeevers are common across Skyrim though few aside from bandits and the desperate choose to cook them.

IngredientsList.name: Chaurus Eggs
IngredientsList.description: Charuses lay large clusters of eggs in underground caves. The are commonly associated with the falmer who care for and raise them.

IngredientsList.name: Chaurus Hunter Antennae
IngredientsList.description: The chaurus hunter is a large and fearsome variant of the chaurus. Its antennae can be easily removed should one be killed.

IngredientsList.name: Chicken's Egg
IngredientsList.description: Chickens are not able to survive the wilds of Skyrim and can only be found on farms where they nest at ground level.

IngredientsList.name: Cyrodilic Spadetail
IngredientsList.description: A small, ruddy freshwater fish with a white face. Commonly found in ponds and lakes.

IngredientsList.name: Daedra Heart
IngredientsList.description: The heart of a dead dremora. If you don't already know how to find them, its probably best not to try.

IngredientsList.name: Eye of Sabre Cat
IngredientsList.description: Sabre cats are large and dangerous predators found in Skyrim's wilderness. A brown furred variant lives in the warmer regions, while a white furred, snowy variant lives in colder areas.

IngredientsList.name: Falmer Ear
IngredientsList.description: The vile falmer are all that remain of the 'snow elves'. Hunted to near extinction they now live in caves and dwemer ruins deep underground where they raise charuses.

IngredientsList.name: Giant's Toe
IngredientsList.description: Giants live in Skyrim's tundra where they herd mammoths. They are immensely powerful and attempting to acquire their toes is best left to seasoned warriors.

IngredientsList.name: Hagraven Claw
IngredientsList.description: Hagravens are the product of the arcane rituals of the forsworn, an ancient tribe of Bretons that live in the Reach. Vile and dangerous Hagravens should be avoided at all costs.

IngredientsList.name: Hagraven Feathers
IngredientsList.description: Hagravens are the product of the arcane rituals of the forsworn, an ancient tribe of Bretons that live in the Reach. Vile and dangerous Hagravens should be avoided at all costs.

IngredientsList.name: Hawk Beak
IngredientsList.description: Hawks can be found across Skyrim, circling high above the ground. Archers can down them to harvest their beak and feathers. Their nests are typically nearby too.

IngredientsList.name: Hawk Feathers
IngredientsList.description: Hawks can be found across Skyrim, circling high above the ground. Archers can down them to harvest their beak and feathers. Their nests are typically nearby too.

IngredientsList.name: Hawk's Egg
IngredientsList.description: Hawks can be found across Skyrim, circling high above the ground. Their nests are often nearby and typically contain one to two eggs.

IngredientsList.name: Histcarp
IngredientsList.description: A small, brown freshwater fish with a white face. Commonly found in ponds and lakes.

IngredientsList.name: Large Antlers
IngredientsList.description: Deer and Elk are round across Skyrim, particularly in the tundra of Whiterun hold. The antlers of males are typically larger than those of females.

IngredientsList.name: Luna Moth Wing
IngredientsList.description: Luna moths are the nocturnal counterpart to the monarch butterfly, they are found near flowers during the night.

IngredientsList.name: Mudcrab Chitin
IngredientsList.description: Mubcrabs are common pests throughout Skyrim's lower elevations. They live alongside rivers and dig down into the mud when sleeping.

IngredientsList.name: Nordic Barnacle
IngredientsList.description: Nordic barnacles grow in clusters on Skyrim's lake and ocean beds. The are commonly found in Lake Illinalta and Honrich, as well as the sea off Skyrim's Northern coast.

IngredientsList.name: Orange Dartwing
IngredientsList.description: Commonly seen during daylight hours, flitting back and forth over Skyrim's many lakes and ponds.

IngredientsList.name: Pine Thrush Egg
IngredientsList.description: Pine thrushes nest at ground level in forested regions.

IngredientsList.name: Powdered Mammoth Tusk
IngredientsList.description: A highly unusual ingredient and the method of preparation has been lost. Old samples can occasionally be found across Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: River Betty
IngredientsList.description: A small, purple freshwater fish with a white face. Commonly found in ponds and lakes.

IngredientsList.name: Rock Warbler Egg
IngredientsList.description: Rock warblers nest at ground level in rocky regions. They are particularly common in the Rift.

IngredientsList.name: Sabre Cat Tooth
IngredientsList.description: Sabre cats are large and dangerous predators found in Skyrim's wilderness. A brown furred variant lives in the warmer regions, while a white furred, snowy variant lives in colder areas.

IngredientsList.name: Salmon Roe
IngredientsList.description: Roe are the eggs of salmon carried upsteam by adults in preparation for spawning. The can be harvested by catching salmon running upstream.

IngredientsList.name: Silverside Perch
IngredientsList.description: A small, silvery grey freshwater fish. Commonly found in ponds and lakes.

IngredientsList.name: Skeever Tail
IngredientsList.description: Skeever are large rodents that live throughout Skyrim, both in the wilderness and around settlements. The carry a variety of diseases.

IngredientsList.name: Slaughterfish Egg
IngredientsList.description: Slaughterfish are medium large, aggressive predatory fish. They lay their eggs on lake beds both in the shallows as well as in deep water.

IngredientsList.name: Slaughterfish Scales
IngredientsList.description: Slaughterfish are medium large, aggressive predatory fish. They will happily attack larger animals, including men, and should not be underestimated.

IngredientsList.name: Small Antlers
IngredientsList.description: Deer and Elk are round across Skyrim, particularly in the tundra of Whiterun hold. The antlers of males are typically larger than those of females.

IngredientsList.name: Spider Egg
IngredientsList.description: Frostbite spides live throughout Skyrim. They typically lay their eggs in caves and abandoned ruins. Their egg sacs are large, white and oval shaped, with an elongated opening.

IngredientsList.name: Spriggan Sap
IngredientsList.description: Spriggans do not normally release their sap, and unlike the taproot it cannot be readily harvested from fallen Spriggans. Extracted sap can occasionally be found in apothecaries.

IngredientsList.name: Taproot
IngredientsList.description: Taproots can be harvest from dead Spriggans. Guardians of the forest, they are found throughout Skyrim's wooded areas.

IngredientsList.name: Torchbug Thorax
IngredientsList.description: Torchbugs ar active at night and easy to spot from a distance due to their brightly glowing abdoments.

IngredientsList.name: Troll Fat
IngredientsList.description: Trolls come in two variants, a brown furred common variety and a white furred variety known as the frost troll. They are found across Skyrim both in the wilderness and in caves.

IngredientsList.name: Dwarven Oil
IngredientsList.description: An exceptionally difficult ingredient to acquire, it can be collected from Dwarven automata that still patrol ancient Dwemer ruins.

IngredientsList.name: Ectoplasm
IngredientsList.description: The essence of ghosts, it is a highly unusual ingredient. Found wherever ghosts are, but that itself is quite the question.

IngredientsList.name: Fire Salts
IngredientsList.description: Can be harvested from dead flame atronachs, though be careful of the fiery explosion that occurs a few seconds after they are defeated.

IngredientsList.name: Frost Salts
IngredientsList.description: Only found as part of frost atronachs, large ice elementals typically only encountered when summoned by conjurers are necromancers.

IngredientsList.name: Glow Dust
IngredientsList.description: Glow dust is dropped by wispmothers and the wisps they summon. Appearing as ghostly women in Skyrim's wilderness, wispmothers are extremely damgerous creatures and should be approached with caution.

IngredientsList.name: Honeycomb
IngredientsList.description: The waxy internal structure of a bee hive. They are built in trees in Skyrim's low elevation forests.

IngredientsList.name: Human Flesh
IngredientsList.description: Although acquiring such an item is likely criminal, human flesh is known to have a variety of alchemical properties.

IngredientsList.name: Human Heart
IngredientsList.description: The human heart has a variety of properties, though you are unlikely to find them available at any reputably alchemists.

IngredientsList.name: Ice Wraith Teeth
IngredientsList.description: Ice wraiths are elongated, floating ice elementals that are commonly found in snowy regions such as Winterhold and the Pale. Highly aggressive they should be approached with caution.

IngredientsList.name: Moon Sugar
IngredientsList.description: An unrefined form of the illegal substance Skooma, moonsugar is rarely seen at respectable stores. Nonetheless is commonly carried by Khajiit caravans.

IngredientsList.name: Pearl
IngredientsList.description: A semi-precious stone found in the pearl-oysters of Solstheim.

IngredientsList.name: Salt Pile
IngredientsList.description: A common cooking ingredient, salt is found throughout the kitchens of Skyrim.

IngredientsList.name: Small Pearl
IngredientsList.description: A semi-precious stone found in the pearl-oysters of Solstheim.

IngredientsList.name: Vampire Dust
IngredientsList.description: Upon being vanquished vampires release a grey, powder known as dust that can be harvested for alchemical purposes.

IngredientsList.name: Void Salts
IngredientsList.description: Produced only by storm atronachs, void salts are an extremely rare ingredient.

IngredientsList.name: Wisp Wrappings
IngredientsList.description: Wisp wrappings can be collected from wispmothers. Appearing as ghostly women in Skyrim's wilderness, wispmothers are extremely dangerous creatures and should be approached with caution.
